Celebrating International Womenâ€™s Day

By Hannah Boyle

LFW AW15 Highlights: Soojin Lee

War and peace collide on a refreshingly warm winter runway

Review: Macbeth

Drama Barn excel in their ultra-cool performance of Macbeth. Joseph D'angelo reviews.

Review: The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde

Theatre Mill's perofrmance of The Strange Case of Dr Jekyll and Mr Hyde is evocative, immersing you within its Victorian world. Lily Papworth reviews.

Classics are the New Black

Penguin have recently released a new set of affordable and accessible classics - The Little Black Classics range. But do such iconic texts need to be made more accessible? Can these 'new' texts still be considered classics? Zoe Thomson considers the impact of Penguin's new endeavour.

Review: South Pacific

Although a seemingly promising production, York Light Opera's South Pacific turned out to be rather disappointing. Ashley Reed reviews.

Review: Double Take - La Dispute and Les Acteurs

For their latest show, the TFTV department have decided to tackle not one but two plays from 18th century French dramatist Marivaux. Translated by J. Murray and adapted by the dramaturg team, the production provided an ample opportunity to witness seldom-performed examples of classic romantic enlightenment comedy. Ricky Jones reviews.

Review: Uncle Vanya

Although a play about boredom, Uncle Vanya is highly entertaining as well as rather touching. Ayomide Sanwo reviews.

Review: Love Is Strange

John Lithgow and Alfred Molina play an elderly couple who run into difficulties after a late-in-life marriage. Sophie Worning reviews what happens next.

Rae Morris: The freedom of release

Finally stepping into a spotlight of her own with the release of Unguarded, the singer-songwriter of the moment talks lyrics, touring and Twitter with Hatti Linnell

Critical thinking

Guardian film critic Peter Bradshaw speaks to Rosemary Collins about disputes with filmmakers and the place of professional film criticism in the age of the Internet

Album Review: Imagine Dragons - Smoke + Mirrors

The foursome return with a follow-up worthy of the credentials afforded by their debut, says Shahreen Vacha

Live Review: Livestock with Jack McNeill and Donkey Zoo

"On 13 February I spent four hours in Fibbers rocking out to the sound of Benjamin Turner's dissertation..."

Adorned

The shoot goes bohemian, embracing Adorned's unique and upcycled pieces

Jameela Jamil: "It doesn't make sense and it doesn't reflect society"

Jameela explains to Chris Owen why her company 'Why Not People?' organises ordinary gigs for disabled individuals, and how she's enlisted Chris Martin and Ed Sheeran to help her cause

Game Review: Besiege

Johannes Huber assesses Spiderling Studios' medieval building game

Peter Molyneux in Godus Outcry

Adam Koper explains why the game designer's latest project failed to live up to expectations

Brand Nu designs

Radim Malinic, founder of design studio, Brand NuTM, talks to Connie Shaw about the changing status of graphics

Review: Fifty Shades of Grey

The eagerly-awaited BDSM blockbuster has finally hit our screens... and it's one of the worst films Will Murray has ever seen

Library by Night - An Evocation

Resident poet Sam Hickford paints vignettes of the library by night with a nod to Paul Verlaine

So Long, Page 3

Fringe success Josie Long chats to Grace Marsh about Edinburgh's infamous comedy festival, Twitter and Page 3

The Shock Market

Joel Down considers whether pieces of art still have the capacity to shock their audience.

My shit week so far

Tom Fennelly looks at what's in the news this week

Ask the Editors: Marcus Lyon's 'mankind on the move'

Photographer Marcus Lyon presents his vision of a claustropobic future. Jaz Hayward and Lara Swan discuss 'Exodus: migrations, megacities and mankind on the move'

Sex, drugs and IVF

Esteemed medical scientist Professor Lord Robert Winston talks to Jack Richardson and the York Union about IVF, politics and religion

Callum McCulloch: 10 Things I've learnt this week

Tales from a first-year unsuccessful cook

Album Review: Enter Shikari - The Mindsweep

Ellie Langford takes the hardcore rock group's latest record for a spin

Review: Selma

The emotionally powerful and politically timely Martin Luther King biopic deserved more recognition at the Academy Awards, argues Liz Tresidder.

Album Review: Bob Dylan - Shadows in the Night

Alex Killeen comments on what he considers "an essential listen for the sound of 2015"

Review: Shaun the Sheep Movie

The latest Aardman animation is the funniest film of the year so far, says Rhys Thompson.

Pangaea - The World As One

Dhechen Lama and Shahreen Vacha share their thoughts on the fashion behind FUSION's latest performance
